title: vrc rough terrain made up of steps

content.raw:
Most of the traversable parts of the current rough terrain used in the walking task consists of flat, horizontal areas connected via untraversable steep slopes. This essentially turns the problem of rough terrain walking into stair climbing or rock hopping instead of actual rough terrain walking with varying slope, etc. 

These steps seem to be a discretization effect resulting from specifying a heightmap scale of 46.9m along z, which causes the 256 possible heightmap values to be stretched along 46.9m resulting in ~18cm tall steps between each value in the heightmap.

It is unclear whether this is the way it's intended to be for the VRC or whether this will be changed towards a more realistic, "smoother" rough terrain that enables/requires actual rough terrain walking instead of just stepping with a flat foot. 

The terrain could be improved by either using a smaller scale along z and replacing the current tall mountains by billboards or buildings (e.g. 5-10m scale along z should be sufficiently high for this task while enabling a much higher resolution), or the other alternative would be to use a custom triangle mesh instead which allows more control about the terrain structure.

(I know you already know about this ... I think ... but I just wanted to write it down as a ticket as well. Additionally an official response whether it will stay this way for VRC or not would be appreciated ... I'll cross-post this on the drc forum).
